title: May 22, 2024 — SQL Release Notes | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
You can now use the TABLE keyword to get a
reference to a table, view, secure view, or query.

The reference created by this keyword is valid only for the scope of the call. In addition, the reference only confers the SELECT
privilege on the table, view, or secure view.
For example, rather than calling the SYSTEM$REFERENCE function to get a reference to a table:
you can use the TABLE keyword:
For details, see Using the TABLE keyword to create a reference to a table, view, or query.
